marklogic.body:
First, please do not call us SM delusional fans because,
A) We are Shinhwa fans and Shinhwa is no longer with SM Entertainment and has not been with them for a very long time now.
B) You have no concrete proof that everyone (or anyone at all, for that matter) here who loves Shinhwa IS delusional because a delusion is pathological (the result of an illness or illness process). So if you do not have anyone's medical records/history on file, it's incredibly presumptuous of you to declare us as such.
If you really feel the need to call us something, just refer to us as Shinhwa fans or Changjos.
Second, you stated that you "respect" Shinhwa and that you did not come here "just" to put them down... and yet, funnily enough, your post is worded in a way that you KNOW would incite indignation amongst Shinhwa fans. You Cold have just written the first part but the the whole "not fair" thing just came across as antagonistic (and whiny, truth to be told).
As someone before me has pointed out, Shinhwa gave credit to the writers/producers to whom they bought the music from. If it sounds like anything at all, it would be because of that. They're not the first Korean to buy music from an American producer and I highly doubt that they will be the last. The number of Kpop overwhelms the number of prolific songwriters in Korea so buying music from foreign writers is the easiest way for Kpop to put out songs. If they wait on the Korean writers, the fans would have to wait for a very long time for their favorite's comeback since a writer does not cater to just one alone.
True, there ARE artists who could write the music themselves, but let's face it, how many of these CAN actually write their own songs? Writing lyrics is hard enough as it is, but creating the music itself takes mad skills and ample time. Can you even imagine how long it would take if they're to write ALL the music and lyrics in one album alone? Buying music that is copyrighted elsewhere is not illegal and is a practice of ALL music labels across the globe.
If they DO win for '', how can it NOT be fair? They own the copyright to the song in Korea, it's in their album, they're promoting it, they're singing it live on various shows - they're basically doing ALL the things the other groups are doing so, again, how can it NOT be fair? Did they take a shortcut through the whole process? Did they buy the votes? Did they coerce anyone to vote for the song? Have they threatened harm to anyone if '' doesn't win? Did they do anything illegal AT ALL to Ensure their win? Is it a REQUIREMENT that each and every song that each artist promotes should be PERSONALLY written by the artist themselves or barring that, be ORIGINALLY and SPECIFICALLY written for the promoting artist? If the answer to everything is no, then again, I ask, how is it NOT fair?
